> <OLD>
>
> Broken landscape did not phase her in the slighest.
>
> Circling about at the edge of Hydras' location, she transformed in mid air then gracefully but swiftly lowered to the ground landing with a loud, metallic thud upon the nearby cliffs and ledges.
>
> Her crimson optics glanced about, internal radar and sensors now being put to the test as they scanned the area further than 10 miles.
>
> For now... she waited.

<NEW>

The ledge that Maxima landed on was large and cragy, difficult to
approach from the ground, and many placed to hide from the air. As
Maxima came down two large birds flew up, protesting her sudden
presence in thier area and they began to circle her. However after a
moment they flew back over to a large well built nest positioned on
the edge of a branch. Small 'cheeping' noises could be heard coming
from within.

As Maxima scanned, sensors reported back primarilly virgin landscape.
Beyond the broken ground from the mining activities of the city, the
rest of the landscape was rolling forests and hills. A few rivers
flowed through, and in the distance animals could be detected creeping
back into the edges of the devestated area.

Around the city were the occasional patrols of tanks, jets,
multi-wheeled, and even a chopper or two, but for the most part it was
quiet. As Maxima was at the edge of things most of this did not come
in her direction. If she chose Maxima would be able make out the
distant forms of Hydras, Terrorsaur, Waspinator, Tarantulus, and
Inferno, as well as the fuzors that were with him: Injector, Buzzclaw,
Terrorgator, and Quickstrike. Around them were several tanks, one of
them, apparently they were attempting to take them into the city.

(TAG)


Preston
